column.name: QUELLSYSTEM
column.comment: Data source

column.name: MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market to which the customer is assigned. Examples are MMC (credit customers who have a contract with VfD2), PUC (credit customers who have a contract with a partner company), MMO (prepaid customers who are directly assigned to VfD2), PUA (prepdaid customers who have a partner company) are), XMK ​​(Cross Market).

column.name: CYCLE_CODE
column.comment: Encryption of the monthly invoice run for which the invoice is created for the customer. The entries always enter the day of the month in which the billing room begins, which then ends on entry - 1 of the following month (e.g. entry 22 denotes the billing period from the 22nd to the 21st of the following month).

column.name: CYCLE_RUN_YEAR
column.comment: Year of the invoice run

column.name: CYCLE_RUN_MONTH
column.comment: Month of the invoice run

column.name: SYS_CREATION_DATE
column.comment: Date of creation of the data record in the operative system

column.name: SYS_UPDATE_DATE
column.comment: Date of modification of the data record in the operative system

column.name: OPERATOR_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the last user

column.name: APPLICATION_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the application that last processed the sentence

column.name: CYCLE_START_DATE
column.comment: First day of the billing cycle.

column.name: CYCLE_CLOSE_DATE
column.comment: The end date of the billing period in which all customer calls up to that point were settled.

column.name: CYCLE_FREQUENCY
column.comment: Cycle duration. Valid Values are: 1 - monthly, 2 - bi-monthly, 3 - quarterly.

column.name: CYCLE_STRT_BILL_DAY
column.comment: The date when the billing run for the specified cycle actually started to execute. The default value for this field is blank. It is set by the system when the Bill Day run is started. This field cannot be modified by the user.

column.name: CYCLE_END_BILL_DAY
column.comment: The date when the billing run for the specified cycle ended. The initial value for this field is blank and  it is set up automatically by the system when the Bill Day run is terminated. This field cannot be modified by the user.

column.name: USAGE_WRITE_LOCK_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether usage can be inserted to the usage table. Valid values: "Y" - write allowed, "N" - write not allowed.

column.name: USAGE_QUERY_LOCK_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether there are data in the table. Valid values: "Y" - read allowed, "N" - read not allowed.

column.name: CYCLE_RUN_ALLOW_IND
column.comment: Indicates if the cycle can start running.

column.name: US_ISSUE_CODE
column.comment: The name by which the usage table is referenced. The synonym is normally USccmm where cc is the cycle code and mm is the month. It is updated when the entry is created. This attribute can be modified by the user. This attribute is relevant only for DYNAMIC accesses to the table.

column.name: AU_ISSUE_CODE
column.comment: The name by which the accumulated usage table is referenced. The synonym is normally AUccmm where cc is the cycle code and mm is the month. It is updated when the entry is created. This attribute can be modified by the user. This attribute is relevant only for DYNAMIC accesses to the table.

column.name: CA_ISSUE_CODE
column.comment: The name by which the country accumulation table is referenced. The synonym is normally CAccmm where cc is the cycle code and mm is the month. It is updated when the entry is created. This attribute can be modified by the user. This attribute is relevant only for DYNAMIC accesses to the table.

column.name: STTC_US_ISSUE_CODE
column.comment: The name by which the USAGE table is referenced. It is updated when the entry is created. This attribute can be modified by the user. This Attribute is relevant only for STATIC accesses to the table.

column.name: STTC_AU_ISSUE_CODE
column.comment: The name by which the ACCUMULATED USAGE table is referenced. It is updated when the entry is created. This attribute can be modified by the user. This attribute is relevant only for STATIC accesses to the table.

column.name: STTC_CA_ISSUE_CODE
column.comment: The name by which the COUNTRY ACCUMULATION table is referenced. It is updated when the entry is created. This attribute can be modified by the user. This attribute is relevant only for STATIC accesses to the table.

column.name: CYCLE_RUN_STATUS
column.comment: The current status of the cycle. Valid values are  N - Not Run, R - Not Confirmed,  C - Confirmed, S - MPS-SYNC-STARTED, E - MPS-SYNC-ENDED, A - Confirm Approved.

column.name: CYCLE_STATUS_DATE
column.comment: The run date of the last time the entry status was updated.

column.name: CONF_APRVL_OPID
column.comment: For future use

column.name: CONF_APRVL_DATE
column.comment: For future use

column.name: US_PHYSICAL_NAME
column.comment: The physical name of usage table.

column.name: AU_PHYSICAL_NAME
column.comment: The physical name of country accumulation table.

column.name: CA_PHYSICAL_NAME
column.comment: The physical name of country accumulation table.

column.name: AU_LCL_ISSUE_CD
column.comment: The physical name of accumulate AU_PHYSICAL_NAME usage table.

column.name: AU_LCL_STAT_ISSUE_CD
column.comment: The name by which the ACCUMULATED USAGE table is referenced

column.name: AU_LCL_COPY_DATE
column.comment: The physical name of accumulate AU_PHYSICAL_NAME  usage table

column.name: BILL_DATE
column.comment: The date that will be printed on the bill as the production date. This date is calculated as follows:  billing production date   +  number of days, as taken from the BILL_CYCLE table.

column.name: HA_AU_ISSUE_CODE
column.comment: The name by which the accumulated usage snapshot in the High Availability machine is referenced. The snapshot name is normally AUccS1 or AUccS2 where cc is the cycle code. It is updated when a new snapshot is created. This attribute is relevant only when accessing the High Availability machine.

column.name: CYCLE_SEQ_NO
column.comment: The sequence number of the bill-cycle.

column.name: SUB_COUNT_DATE
column.comment: Subscriber count date

column.name: QA_RUN_STS
column.comment: QA Pre-Selection run Status of the cycle ( N-Not run     S-Started to run    C-Completed)

column.name: QA_STRT_BILL_DAY
column.comment: Containts the run date of BLCYXT in QA Mode, to be used in next jobs to define the output file name/location

column.name: BILL_SECOND_DATE
column.comment: Will be maintained.

column.name: LATE_CONF_APRVL_DATE
column.comment: For future use. Late Confirmation approval date

column.name: FILLER
column.comment: N/A
